intro: Digitaria delicata, commonly known as silverhair grass, is a perennial grass species native to the Americas. It is characterized by its fine, silver-haired appearance, which gives it its common name. This plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as fields and roadsides. It has narrow, elongated leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Digitaria delicata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate, feathery foliage.
